subject: Technology
title: Transformers: Voltage Shape-Shifters
description: A fast breakdown of Transformers: Voltage Shape-Shifters for builders.

hook.text: The grey boxes on power poles aren't decoration. They convert deadly high-voltage electricity to the safe kind in your home.

buildup.text: Transformers change voltage levels using two coils of wire around a shared iron core. No moving parts needed.

discovery.text: Power plants generate at medium voltage, step up to 400,000 volts for transmission, then step down to 120 or 240 for your home.

twist.text: Transformers only work with alternating current. This is the real reason AC beat DC in the War of Currents.

climax.text: Without transformers, every neighborhood would need its own power plant. Long-distance electricity would be impossible.

punchline.text: Transformers are the unsung heroes that make the entire power grid possible.

quiz.question: Why was the transformer crucial to AC winning over DC?
options: It made AC cheaper to produce
Transformers only work with AC and enable long-distance power transmission
It made AC safer for homes
